name.ch: 理論與實務整合專題實作(一)

goal.en: The guidance of students in learning the hydrogen production and storage, and the application of fuel cells involves exploring issues related to energy conversion efficiency and material systems. Considering the arrival of net-zero carbon emissions by 2050, the actual scenarios for the development and application of hydrogen energy are contemplated. This approach enables students to delve into relevant issues surrounding the hydrogen economy, gaining an understanding of the foundational knowledge and applications that position hydrogen as the ultimate clean energy source. In addition to the existing teaching methods, practical projects are introduced to connect courses within the curriculum, providing students with opportunities for hands-on experience.
goal.ch: 將引導學生學習氫氣的產生，氫氣的儲存與燃料電池應用等能源轉換效率與材料系統等相關議題，思考2050年淨零碳排的世代來臨時，氫能所要發展與應用的實際情境，使學生學習氫經濟的相關議題，了解氫成為終極潔淨能源的相關基礎知識與應用。在原有的教學方式之外，增加實務專題，以串聯課群的課程，提供學生實作之機會。

content.en:
Fundamental courses: Aligned with the Introduction to Materials Science and Engineering and Introduction to Energy and Engineering.
Literature Survey: Utilizing library databases for practical learning through literature and patent searches to understand current data and indicators in the field of hydrogen energy. This includes exploring the current efficiency of hydrogen production systems and global energy policies in various regions.
Assembling Electrochemical Cells to Understand the Process of Chemical Energy Conversion to Electrical Energy: The Galvanic Cell, a device that converts chemical energy into electrical energy for performing work, is studied. It involves spontaneous redox reactions producing cells like the zinc-copper battery, also known as a voltaic cell.
content.ch:
基礎課程實作：配合材料科學工程概論與能源與工程導論。
1. 文獻探索：使用圖書館資料庫查閱文獻與專利的實務學習，了解目前氫能領域的相關數據與指標。如目前的產氫系統效率，或者全球各地區的能源政策。
2. 學習組裝電化電池，以了解化學能轉換成電能的過程：加凡尼電池(Galvanic Cell)，是將化學能轉換成電能用以做功的裝置，其為自發性氧化還原化反應產生如鋅銅電池，又稱作伏打電池。

grading.en: Classroom performance and attendance (30 ％) and experimental results ( 70％).
grading.ch: 課堂表現與出席30％；實作成果70％
